title: WTB: Billy Sullivan PSA 2/3 range... Multiple backs needed
author: Joshchisox08

posts.post_title: WTB: Billy Sullivan PSA 2/3 range... Multiple backs needed
posts.post_content:
Looking for a Sullivan with a unique back as in anything other than Piedmont or Sweet Caporal though I would listen in on them.


PSA 2-3 range



[STRIKE]Pied 150[/STRIKE] SGC 20 
[STRIKE]Pied 350[/STRIKE] PSA 3 (MK)
[STRIKE]SC 150/25 [/STRIKE] PSA 3
[STRIKE]SC 150/30 [/STRIKE] PSA 3
[STRIKE]SC 350/25[/STRIKE] PSA 3
SC 350/30
Sov 150
[STRIKE]Sov 350 GF[/STRIKE] PSA Authentic Altered & Raw Beater
Brown Hindu
Old Mill

Just wanted to let you know that Sullivan doesn't come with a Polar Bear back.

Your only other confirmed options besides Piedmont or Sweet Caporal are going to be Sovereign, Brown Hindu, or Old Mill.

[quote name="Tom S." post=1524315]Just wanted to let you know that Sullivan doesn't come with a Polar Bear back.

Your only other confirmed options besides Piedmont or Sweet Caporal are going to be Sovereign, Brown Hindu, or Old Mill.[/QUOTE]

I feel like I should have known that. Had I looked at my checklist. Series, players, and back combinations aren't my strong point quite yet. Still very rusty on that.

I thought it was also made with an El Principe de Gale back (although I've never seen one). Is this wrong? This is what confuses me: [url]http://www.vintagecardprices.com/card-profile/211363/1909-White-Borders-EPDG-Billy-Sullivan-472-Baseball-Card-Value-Prices.htm[/url]

[quote name="pbspelly" post=1531914]I thought it was also made with an El Principe de Gale back (although I've never seen one). Is this wrong? This is what confuses me: [url]http://www.vintagecardprices.com/card-profile/211363/1909-White-Borders-EPDG-Billy-Sullivan-472-Baseball-Card-Value-Prices.htm[/url][/QUOTE]

I have it as being possible just not confirmed. I'm sure Jeff Throm would know. He's the EPDG expert :D

[quote name="pbspelly" post=1531914]I thought it was also made with an El Principe de Gale back (although I've never seen one). Is this wrong? This is what confuses me: [url]http://www.vintagecardprices.com/card-profile/211363/1909-White-Borders-EPDG-Billy-Sullivan-472-Baseball-Card-Value-Prices.htm[/url][/QUOTE]

Site is confusing. Sullivan is possible but unconfirmed, so at this point I honestly do not believe it exists.

BTW, example of why I would highly doubt that site:
[url]http://www.vintagecardprices.com/card-profile/211286/1909-White-Borders-EPDG-Barney-Pelty-383-Baseball-Card-Value-Prices.htm[/url]

It just doesn't exist......yet they imply that it does, just like with the Sullivan.

[quote name="Thromdog" post=1532035]Site is confusing. Sullivan is possible but unconfirmed, so at this point I honestly do not believe it exists.

BTW, example of why I would highly doubt that site:
[url]http://www.vintagecardprices.com/card-profile/211286/1909-White-Borders-EPDG-Barney-Pelty-383-Baseball-Card-Value-Prices.htm[/url]

It just doesn't exist......yet they imply that it does, just like with the Sullivan.[/QUOTE]

Shit I was hoping that of the many times I've seen your EPDGs I simply overlooked a Sullivan and you had duplicates :(
I've had my eye out for a while and kind of suspected that it didn't exist. Just like I also suspect there aren't any Sporting Life Cabinets (W600) with him either, even though he is listed.

Sullivan seems pretty scarce for some reason or another. I've always liked the card and I'm a Sox fan so him being the first real catcher for them kind of makes me like it even more.

He is actually the only one that I have been able to complete the back run on so far for my White Sox T206 master set.

Those three are going to be the ultimate challenge.

Hey Josh,

I forgot to mention that the SC350/25 you picked up is a beauty for a 3.

There is a plate scratch that shows that Sullivan and Chase (Pink Portrait) 
were in the same sheet position on different PD150 sheets.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=260266&d=1486254688[/IMG]

Both Sullivan and Chase (Pink) are found with several different crop marks.

you're proving that this site is a great place for people with the best knowledge in the hobby. 

Thank you for sharing this it makes me like the card even more and I had no idea about any of it :)

Not looking to sell any of these (some are not in the greatest condition, anyway), but you might find them interesting.  I have these Sullivan backs, which I believe to be the complete set as far as types (not including differences in numbers, such as 150/25, etc.), although, as noted earlier in this thread, there is a tiny bit of doubt about whether an El Principe De Gales exists.  

In case you are interested, the portrait used on Sullivan's T206 was based on a photo taken by Carl Horner sometime prior to 1903 and reused over and over. I own all of the other Sullivan items shown here except for the Breisch Williams. The Horner cabinet portrait of him in a suit was, undoubtedly, taken at the same sitting as the photo of him in uniform that was used as a basis for all of the cards.  Someone else here on the board has the Horner cabinet of him in uniform.

Just so you know, he was my great grandfather, which is the main reason I have amassed all of this.

In case you are interested, the portrait used on Sullivan's T206 was based on a photo taken by Carl Horner sometime prior to 1903 and reused over and over. I own all of the other Sullivan items shown here except for the Breisch Williams. The Horner cabinet portrait of him in a suit was, undoubtedly, taken at the same sitting as the photo of him in uniform that was used as a basis for all of the cards.
